abstract: The Internet advertising industry’s “new” privacy principles are essentially unchanged from the old ones. Trade groups rejected the enhanced disclosures and protections suggested by Google and other industry players.
snippet: The Internet advertising industry’s “new” privacy principles are essentially unchanged from the old ones. Trade groups rejected the enhanced disclosures and protections suggested by Google and other industry players.
lead_paragraph: Update | 5:25 p.m.  The post has been corrected to note that the Interactive Advertising Bureau was an equal member of the group of four trade associations making this proposal, not its leader. A reference has been added to the self-regulatory aspect of the proposal.

headline.main: Four Privacy Protections the Online Ad Industry Left Out
